results.title: Mr and Mrs Bridge
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Cineplex Odeon Films in association with Miramax
results.brief_description: Naive, prudish, yet sweet and endearing, India Bridge (Joanna Woodward) devotes every waking moment to her family. She has no understanding of current affairs because that’s Walter’s (Paul Newman) domain - he knows everything and he’s never wrong. That’s Mr and Mrs. Bridge, or is it? As their children mature and discover boys, girls, sex and silliness, India and Walter suddenly face challenging issues. When Mrs. Bridge decides to show that she is more than a doormat, her new-found independence sparks a heartwarming journey for the whole family - from curious moments, to crisis after amusing crisis. Co-starring Blythe Danner, Simon Callow, Kyra Sedgwick, Robert Sean Leonard, Margaret Welsh, Austin Pendleton and Saundra McClain. Based on the novels “Mr Bridge” and “Mrs Bridge” by Evan S. Connell.

results.title: The Snapper
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Lynda Myles and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Curley’s are a working class Dublin family headed by Dessie, (Colm Meaney), an affable plasterer with a taste for the drink, and Kay, (Ruth McCabe), who keeps their six children in line. This topsy-turvy household falls into a tailspin when 20 year-old Sharon, (Tina Kellegher) announces that she is pregnant. Tensions mount when it becomes obvious that she has no intention of revealing the child’s paternity. As the time approaches for the little “snapper’ to be born, Dessie is becoming a New Age Man while Sharon learns to turn life’s little “accidents’ into big achievements. This is a delightful Irish comedy, well handled by director Frears and with quality performances by Meany and Kellegher.

results.title: Lady Chatterley's lover
results.creator_credit: Just Jaeckin, Andre Djaoui, Christopher Pearce, Cine-Artist GMBH, London Cannon Films and Producteurs Associes
results.brief_description: Based on the famous and scandalous novel by D. H. Lawrence, a classic love story banned for over 30 years when first published. This controversial literary classic is brought to the screen by the director of “Emmanuelle”, and stars Sylvia Kristel as Lady Chatterley; rich, titled and beautiful but increasingly restless and frustrated by her passionless marriage to Sir Clifford (Shane Briant). Increasingly attracted to the handsome Mellors (Nicholas Clay), her husband’s gamekeeper, she is soon seeking physical and emotional satisfaction in a passionate affair, oblivious to the ensuing social scandal. Cast includes Ann Mitchell, Elizabeth Spriggs and Peter Bennett.

results.title: The Untouchables
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Art Linson, Linson Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Al Capone reigned as King in Prohibition Chicago, 1931. A team of determined government investigators, led by a young Federal Treasury agent is committed to bringing Capone to justice. Unbribable and incorruptible, they are “The Untouchables”. Kevin Costner stars as the legendary Eliot Ness in this bold action thriller by famed director Brian De Palma. Along with Costner, Sean Connery gives an award winning performance as tough beat cop Jimmy Malone, while Andy Garcia and Charles Martin Smith are the rest of the team. Robert De Niro is chilling as the sadistic but seductive Al Capone; a man who smiles when he kills.

results.title: The City's edge
results.creator_credit: Ken Quinnell, Errol Sullivan, Pom Oliver, CB Films (France), New South Wales Film Corporation and Oliver Sullivan Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatic contemporary love story of an aspiring young writer from the country and an urban woman struggling against the guilt of her first sexual experiences. They become involved with each other, their pasts and a frightening narrow world that is dominated by a charismatic young First Nations man who is driven by a contempt for life and a fierce hatred of white Australian society. Starring Hugo Weaving, Tommy Lewis, Shirley Cameron and Mark Lee. Co-starring Ralph Cotterill, Julie McGregor, Frederic Abbott, Martin Harris and Katrina Foster. Based on the novel by W. A. Harbinson.

results.title: The Roaring Twenties
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: No other actor played a gangster with the conviction of James Cagney. As Eddie Bartlett, James Cagney epitomises the classic ani-hero - a lawless man in a lawless time. Humphrey Bogart cut his teeth with his rough and tough portrayal of George - Eddie’s closest buddy and partner in crime. The combined talents of these two stars make “The Roaring Twenties” a landmark in cinematic history - the seminal gangster movie. Co-starring Priscilla Lane, Gladys George, Jeffrey Lynn, Frank McHugh and Paul Kelly.

results.title: Night and day
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Arthur Schwartz and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The spectacular musical biography of one of this century’s greatest composers - Cole Porter. Cary Grant portrays Cole Porter and Night and Day shows the popular songwriter’s amazing life story - from studying law at Yale, his bravery in World War I, his romance with Linda Lee to his first Broadway success. Features the evergreen hit songs “Begin the Beguine”, “I Get a Kick Out of You”, “My Heart Belongs to Daddy” and “Let’s fall in love.” Starring Cary Grant and Alexis Smith. Co-starring Monty Woolley, Ginny Simms, Jane Wyman and Mary Martin.

results.title: Ascendancy
results.creator_credit: Edward Bennett, Ian Elsey, Penny Clark and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Ireland 1920. Rebellion against British rule is gathering force. Belfast is ominously quiet. Safe inside her fathers mansion, Connie (Julie Covington), is protected from the world. Her father manages the shipyard responsible for the family fortune while she is treated for a severely paralysed arm, an hysterical ailment connected to her brothers’ death during the Great War. Connie, oblivious to the looming crisis wanders dreamily around her brother’s room while the city erupts in bitter rioting. Even the household is affected when Connie’s maid, a Catholic, is driven out by the Protestant servants. British troops arrive and some of the officers are invited to a tea-party where Connie meets young Lieutenant Ryder (Ian Charleson) who has a profound effect upon her, shattering her fantasies of war and forcing her to confront its terrible reality. Co-starring John Phillips and Susan Engel. FilmFest Berlin 1983 Golden Bear-Best Film.

results.title: A Private function
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Mowbray, Mark Shivas and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: Driven by the desperate social ambitions of his wife Joyce, (Maggie Smith), one act of folly turned the life of sensitive, small-town chiropodist, Gilbert Chilvers, (Michael Palin), into a nightmare. With Britain in the grip of post-war rationing, Gilbert steals Betty, a contraband pig being secretly fattened by a group of town dignitaries for a banquet to celebrate the Other Royal Wedding. But there is a price to pay. Gilbert’s squeamishness, his mother-in-law’s senility, and Betty’s incontinence lead to trouble and Gilbert ends up with blood on his hands and the police on the doorstep.

results.title: Camelot
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the very successful Broadway show, “Camelot” features songs from the renowned songwriting team of Lerner and Loewe. Starring Richard Harris, Vanessa Redgrave, Franco Nero, David Hemmings and Lionel Jeffries, it tells of the tragic romantic triangle between Arthur, Guinevere and Sir Lancelot.
